author: apetitjean
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
```powershell
> New-Item -Type file -Name test.ps1 -Value '"Hello World"'

> ./test.ps1
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

Display the string "Hello World".

Actual behavior
---------------
```powershell
.\test.ps1 : AuthorizationManager check failed.
At line:1 char:1
+ .\test.ps1
+ ~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : SecurityError: (:) [], PSSecurityException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : UnauthorizedAccess
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSEdition                      Core
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
CLRVersion
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.16
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
```

When trying to get the current execution policy, here's what I get : 

```powershell
> Get-ExecutionPolicy
Get-ExecutionPolicy : Unable to load DLL 'api-ms-win-core-toolhelp-l1-1-0': Le module spécifié est introuvable. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x8007007E)
At line:1 char:1
+ Get-ExecutionPolicy
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Get-ExecutionPolicy], DllNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.DllNotFoundException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetExecutionPolicyCommand
``` 

My system is Windows 7 SP1 64 bits.

comments.author: apetitjean
comments.body: This bug has been corrected. It works just well in PS core 6.0.1

title: AuthorizationManager check failed when executing a script
